name: ALRS-1
notes: materials of basalt characteristics taken from a mine in New South Wales are used

name: BP-1
notes: Discovered as waste pile in aggregate quarry

name: CUG-1A
notes: Demonstrates comparatively lower softening point and can achieve densification with reduced energy input relative to JSC-2

name: CUMT-1
institution: China Univ. of Mining and Tech

name: FJS-1
notes: Manufactured from Mt. Fuji basaltic lava

name: FJS-2
notes: Contains the same basalt as FJS-1 but with olivine added. Developed for JAXA to represent the chemistry, mineralogy and geotechnical properties of mare basalt lunar regolith.

name: JLU-H
notes: Contains coarse particles up to 50 mm

name: JSC-1AF
notes: Very fine particle size distribution variant

name: KIGAM-L1
institution: Korea Institute of Geoscience and Mineral Resources

name: KLS-1
institution: Korea Institute of Civil Engineering and Building Technology

name: Kohyama Simulant
notes: specialized simulant for water and oxygen extraction

name: LuNOR
notes:
A novel feature of this simulant is that it contains no
processed mineral concentrates but rather focuses on natural rock using resources
local to Norway

name: MLS-1
notes: High-Ti Mare derived from Duluth complex
particle_size_distribution: ground into a Particle Size Distribution (PSD) to resemble lunar soil

name: MLS-2
notes: highland simulant made of ground anorthosite from the Duluth Gabbro Complex, Minnesota

name: NEU-1
notes: Mix of basalt and volcanic slag

name: NU-LHT
notes: Part of NU-LHT series, includes NU-LHT-2M variant

name: NUW-LHT-5M
notes: Variant of NU-LHT with accurate glass

name: OPR Agglutinate
notes: Agglutinate component made out of any of the above simulants

name: OPRH4N
notes: Highland simulant that is a blend of basalt from the San Francisco volcanic field in Arizona and anorthosite from the Shawmere anorthosite complex in Canada. Designed to replicate the chemical, mineralogical, and geotechnical properties of lunar regolith. Agglutinates can be added (OPRH4W variant available).

name: TBG-1
notes: Best fit simulant to Apollo 14 soil R07 with distance d=10.00

name: TUBS-H
notes: Produced using a flexible preparation method where basalt is supplemented with minerals or sintered glass to achieve specific objectives

name: WHU-1
notes: Prepared based on particle size distribution data from samples returned by the Chang'e-5 mission

name: LMS-2
notes: Updated particle size up to 2 mm

name: LHS-2
notes: Updated particle size up to 2 mm

name: NU-LHT-4M
notes: Glass component offset by agglutinate glass

name: OPRFLCROSS1
notes: Volatile ice simulant based on LCROSS

name: OUCM-1
notes: Included in lists but targeted for Mars/General

name: CM-2
notes: Included in lists but targeted for Mars/General
